Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: CURVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to the curve or trace.
Column Comment.2: DIGITAL CURVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the digital log curve interval.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth of the curve data at the bottom of the logging pass.
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.6: CURVE QUALITY: The quality of the well log curve.
Column Comment.7: LOG DIGIT CORRECTION METHOD: This reference table identifies the methodused to correct the log depth.
Column Comment.9: DEPTH INCREMENT OUOM: Depth increment original unit of measure.
Column Comment.10: DIGITIZED DATE: Date the wireline log was digitized.
Column Comment.11: DIGITIZER: Code identifying the person or company that digitized the wireline log.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: NULL VALUE: Number indicating a null value within a stream of digits.
Column Comment.15: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth of the curve data at the beginning of the logging pass.
Column Comment.19: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
